alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 8:46AM CST until March 13 at 9:36AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Sulphur River Near Talco affecting Morris, Titus, Red River and Franklin Counties. For the Sulphur River...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sulphur River Near Talco. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of the heavily wooded floodplain. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the river bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CST Thursday the stage was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 21.5 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.8 feet on 04/15/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 845 AM CST.
